title: Supply Chain Performance & Sales Intelligence Dashboard
para: This project delivers a full analytical experience for supply chain and commercial performance. Using Excel datasets cleaned through Power Query and modeled in Power BI, the dashboard uncovers sales patterns, order behavior across regions, and product performance metrics—including dynamic KPI visuals and an animated globe for geographic insights. It highlights end-to-end BI development skills including ETL, data modeling, DAX, and dashboard storytelling.
subPara: Power BI, and DAX.All raw data was sourced from Excel files and transformed using Power Query, where data cleaning, standardization, and conditional columns were applied to prepare the dataset for analysis.The Power BI data model was designed following best practices, with fact and dimension tables connected through a structured schema to ensure accurate analysis and high performance.Custom DAX measures and calculated columns were developed to calculate key business KPIs such as Total Sales, Total Revenue, Profit, Order Volume, Growth Trends, Truck Utilization, and Product Performance metrics.The dashboard consists of multiple analytical pages, each designed to answer specific business questions:Sales Overview provides high-level KPIs, market trends, category performance, and a dynamic truck utilization visual that responds to filters.Orders Analysis Overview focuses on order distribution across regions, countries, and years, using an interactive 3D globe and comparison charts.Sales Analysis delivers detailed insights into sales trends by region and compares total revenue and profit across payment types.Top Products Performance Summary highlights the top three performing products (Cleats, Women’s Apparel, Indoor/Outdoor Games), with in-depth metrics including produced vs. sold quantities, revenue, available stock, and average defect rates.This project demonstrates strong capabilities in data preparation, analytical modeling, DAX development, and storytelling through interactive visualizations, making it suitable for operational monitoring and strategic decision-making.

title: HR Workforce & Attrition Analytics Dashboard — End-to-End Data Analysis Project
para: This HR Analytics project analyzes workforce demographics, salary trends, performance ratings, and attrition across company branches. I used Python (Pandas & NumPy) for data cleaning and exploratory charts, then imported the cleaned data into Power BI for modeling using DAX measures and calculated columns. The final dashboards provide clear insights into employee distribution, workload, compensation, and key factors influencing attrition.
subPara: This comprehensive HR Analytics project delivers a full end-to-end analysis of workforce data across multiple business dimensions, including employee demographics, job levels, departments, locations, compensation, performance, and workforce dynamics.The project began with raw data provided across multiple Excel files. These files were consolidated, cleaned, and transformed using Python, leveraging Pandas and NumPy to handle missing values, standardize data formats, create derived features, and ensure overall data quality. During this stage, exploratory data analysis was conducted using Matplotlib and Seaborn to identify patterns, correlations, and potential business signals.After data preparation, the cleaned dataset was imported into Power BI, where a robust data model was built by defining relationships between fact and dimension tables. Advanced DAX measures and calculated columns were created to calculate key HR metrics such as headcount, average income, performance scores, attrition indicators, workforce distribution, and departmental KPIs.The final output consists of five interactive Power BI dashboards, each designed to address a specific business perspective:Workforce OverviewDepartment & Job Level AnalysisCompensation & Performance InsightsGeographic & Travel AnalysisWorkforce Trends & Attrition AnalysisThese dashboards enable stakeholders to explore workforce patterns, identify operational strengths and risks, compare departments and locations, and support data-driven decision-making related to talent management, compensation planning, and organizational strategy.This project demonstrates strong capabilities in data cleaning, analytical thinking, data modeling, DAX development, and professional dashboard design aligned with real business use cases.

title: Abdul Samad Al Qurashi — Sales & Products Analytics Dashboard
para: Built a full sales analytics solution for Abdul Samad Al Qurashi using data extracted from the official website.Structured the raw data into SQL Server and performed modeling and cleaning in Power BI.Designed interactive dashboards covering sales KPIs, product performance, geographic distribution, and price segments.Created DAX measures for revenue growth, order value, category analysis, and monthly trends.Insights revealed the dominance of perfumes & oud, seasonal revenue drops, and high demand in GCC markets.Delivered a clean, business-focused Power BI dashboard supporting strategic sales decisions.
subPara: This project delivers a comprehensive sales and product analytics solution for Abdul Samad Al Qurashi, a leading luxury brand specializing in perfumes, oud, incense, and personal care products.The data was collected from the official website and organized into a structured SQL Server database, including products, pricing, orders, and geographic details.SQL was used to clean, normalize, and prepare the data before connecting it to Power BI for advanced analysis.Inside Power BI, a star-schema data model was designed using fact and dimension tables to ensure accuracy and performance.A set of interactive dashboards was built to analyze sales performance by country, branch, product category, and price segment.Custom DAX measures and calculated columns were created to calculate revenue, growth rates, average order value, and product performance metrics.The analysis revealed strong demand for perfumes and oud products, seasonal revenue fluctuations, and significant differences in performance across regions and branches.The final dashboards provide actionable business insights to support data-driven decisions in sales strategy, pricing, inventory planning, and market expansion.

title: Toyota Sales & Revenue Intelligence Dashboard – Abdul Latif Jameel Motors (KSA)
para: This project delivers a full analytics solution for Abdul Latif Jameel Motors using Excel, Python, and Power BI. I cleaned and analyzed the raw data using Pandas and NumPy, and generated exploratory visuals with Matplotlib and Seaborn. The refined dataset was modeled in Power BI, supported with DAX measures and calculated columns. The final output includes three interactive dashboards covering sales performance, revenue analysis, and vehicle model insights. These dashboards present clear KPIs, trends, and comparisons to support data-driven decision-making. The project emphasizes clean design, consistent branding, and a highly interactive user experience.
subPara: This project is a comprehensive end-to-end data analytics solution developed for Abdul Latif Jameel Motors – Saudi Arabia, focusing on vehicle sales performance, revenue analysis, and branch-level insights.The raw data was initially stored across multiple Excel files, which were consolidated, cleaned, and prepared using Python with Pandas and NumPy. During this phase, exploratory data analysis was conducted and supported by visualizations created using Matplotlib and Seaborn to validate trends, detect outliers, and answer key business questions.After data preparation, the refined dataset was imported into Power BI, where a structured data model was built with clearly defined relationships. Advanced DAX measures and calculated columns were developed to accurately calculate KPIs such as total sales, revenue growth, branch performance, and model-level metrics.The final solution consists of three interactive dashboards, each designed to address a specific business perspective: sales performance, revenue and growth analysis, and vehicle model insights. The dashboards feature dynamic filters, time-based analysis, and a clean, Toyota-aligned visual design to support executive-level decision-making.This project demonstrates the full analytics lifecycle—from raw data processing to insight-driven dashboards—highlighting strong capabilities in data engineering, business analysis, and data visualization.

title: Saudi Arabia Real Estate Market Analysis & Interactive Power BI Dashboard
para: This project analyzes real real-estate data sourced from the official Saudi government platform, covering multiple cities, regions, property types, and price trends. I performed data cleaning and preparation using Python (pandas, NumPy, regex) and validated key metrics through exploratory visualizations created with Matplotlib and Seaborn. The cleaned dataset was imported into Power BI, where I built a complete analytical data model and developed numerous DAX measures and calculated columns to evaluate a variety of market metrics.

title: Property Management Dashboard — Real Estate Performance & Sales Analysis
para: This Real Estate Property Management dashboard was built using Excel data and developed entirely in Power BI. The project includes full data cleaning with Power Query, data modeling, and the creation of DAX measures and calculated columns. The dashboard provides key insights into revenue, sales channels, property types, client performance, and country-level distribution. It helps identify top clients, track payment status, and highlight the most profitable properties to support strategic decision-making.
subPara: This project presents a comprehensive Real Estate Analytics Dashboard developed using Excel data and Power BI.The dataset was originally provided across multiple Excel files, requiring extensive data cleaning, transformation, and consolidation using Power Query.A structured data model was built to ensure accurate relationships between properties, clients, sales transactions, locations, and payment statuses.Advanced DAX measures and calculated columns were created to calculate key financial metrics such as total revenue, expenses, net income, and properties sold.The dashboard analyzes sales performance over time, highlighting monthly trends, seasonal fluctuations, and revenue concentration across different periods.It also provides insights into sales channels, property types, geographic distribution, top clients, and payment status to support operational and strategic decisions.Overall, the dashboard enables stakeholders to monitor business performance, identify risks such as pending payments, and uncover growth opportunities across markets and property segments.

title: Hotel Booking & Revenue Analytics Dashboard
para: A full hotel analytics project built using Excel, Python, and Power BI. The data was cleaned and prepared using Pandas & NumPy, with exploratory visuals created using Seaborn and Matplotlib. After modeling the data in Power BI and building DAX measures, four interactive dashboards were developed to analyze revenue, reservations, guest types, room categories, and country-level performance.
subPara: This project is an end-to-end Hotel Booking & Revenue Analytics solution designed to transform raw hotel reservation data into actionable business insights.The analysis focuses on understanding booking behavior, revenue performance, guest segmentation, distribution channels, and cancellation patterns to support data-driven decision-making in hotel operations.The project started with raw data stored across multiple Excel files, which required consolidation and preprocessing.Using Python (Pandas & NumPy), the data was cleaned, standardized, and validated by handling missing values, correcting inconsistencies, and preparing it for analysis.During the exploratory phase, Seaborn and Matplotlib were used to visualize trends such as seasonal demand, revenue fluctuations, cancellation behavior, and guest demographics.These visual insights helped identify key performance patterns before building the final dashboards.The cleaned dataset was then imported into Power BI, where a structured data model was created using fact and dimension tables.Several DAX measures and calculated columns were developed to support KPIs such as Total Revenue, ADR, RevPAR, Confirmed vs Cancelled Reservations, and segment-level performance metrics.Finally, four interactive dashboards were designed to provide a comprehensive view of hotel performance:Revenue Dashboard – tracks revenue trends, monthly performance, and confirmed vs cancelled revenue.Geographical Dashboard – analyzes bookings and revenue by country and market.Guests & Reservations Dashboard – explores guest types, room categories, booking behavior, and cancellation patterns.Business Insights & Recommendations Dashboard – summarizes key analytical findings and translates them into clear business recommendations and actionable solutions.This project demonstrates strong skills in data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, data modeling, DAX, and business-oriented dashboard design.

title: Blinkit Business Performance Analytics Dashboards
para: A comprehensive analysis of Blinkit’s business covering sales performance, product trends, customer feedback, and area-wise operations. The project includes 6 fully interactive dashboards that support decision-making, highlight top-performing areas, and enhance customer satisfaction.

title: E-Commerce Sales Insights & Performance Analytics Dashboard
para: A complete end-to-end data analytics project designed to analyze E-Commerce sales performance and support business decision-making. Excel data was cleaned and transformed using Python (Pandas & NumPy), with statistical visuals generated using Matplotlib & Seaborn. Power BI was used for advanced data modeling with DAX and to build fully-interactive dashboards showing key KPIs, customer segmentation, product performance, regional insights, and shipping behavior.

title: Uber Trip Analysis Dashboard — End-to-End Data Analytics Project
para: An end-to-end data analytics project built with Excel and Power BI. Multiple Excel files were ingested, consolidated and cleaned using Power Query; the data model was designed with optimized relationships and calculated columns. I created DAX measures to calculate KPIs such as Total Bookings, Booking Value, Average Trip Distance, Avg Trip Duration, and Day/Night breakdowns. The deliverable includes three interactive dashboards: Overview (summary KPIs, payment & trip type breakdowns), Time Analysis (hourly/weekday heatmap, pickup-time trends), and Trip Details (row-level table). The dashboards enable deep exploration of booking patterns, vehicle performance, and location-based insights to support operational decisions.
subPara: This project presents an end-to-end data analytics solution for Uber trip data using Excel and Power BI.The dataset was originally provided across multiple Excel files, which required consolidation, cleaning, and transformation before analysis.Using Power Query, I performed the full ETL process, including merging files, handling missing values, correcting data types, standardizing date and time formats, and creating derived columns such as pickup hour, day name, trip type (day/night), passenger group, and distance categories.After preparing the data, I designed an optimized data model in Power BI and created multiple DAX measures and calculated columns to track key performance indicators such as Total Bookings, Total Booking Amount, Average Booking Value, Total Trip Distance, Average Trip Duration, and time-based metrics.The project delivers three interactive dashboards:Overview Dashboard: Provides high-level KPIs and insights into booking trends, payment methods, trip types, vehicle performance, and top pickup/drop-off locations.Time Analysis Dashboard: Focuses on temporal patterns using hourly trends, weekday analysis, heatmaps, and pickup time distributions to identify peak demand periods.Trip Details Dashboard: Offers a detailed, row-level view of individual trips, enabling drill-down analysis and validation.This dashboard-driven analysis helps uncover demand patterns, customer behavior, and operational insights that can support decision-making related to fleet allocation, pricing strategy, and service optimization.

title: Health Care Analytics & Interactive Dashboard
para: An end-to-end Health Care Analytics project using Excel, Python, and Power BI. Performed data cleaning with Pandas & NumPy, visual exploration with Seaborn & Matplotlib, and built a complete Power BI dashboard (Overview, Patients, Doctors). Delivered KPIs for billing, treatments, doctor performance, patient segmentation, and diagnostic insights using advanced DAX and clean data modeling.
subPara: Health Care Data Analytics Project focused on analyzing medical, financial, and operational healthcare data using Excel, Python, and Power BI.The project started with multiple Excel files, where data was cleaned, transformed, and prepared using Python (Pandas & NumPy). Exploratory analysis and visualizations were created using Seaborn and Matplotlib to understand cost distribution, patient demographics, visit types, and department performance.The prepared data was then loaded into Power BI, where a structured data model was built along with DAX measures and calculated columns to track key KPIs such as billing, treatment and medication costs, insurance coverage, out-of-pocket expenses, patient visits, and doctor performance.The final output is a set of three interactive dashboards (Overview, Patients, and Doctors) that provide insights into healthcare operations, patient behavior, and clinical performance, enabling data-driven decision-making.The solution highlights trends, identifies cost drivers, and helps stakeholders monitor performance across departments, services, and time periods.

title: Pizza Sales Analytics & Interactive BI Dashboards
para: A complete Pizza Sales analysis built using Excel, Power Query, and Power BI. I cleaned and transformed the raw Excel dataset using Power Query, created a structured data model, and developed three interactive dashboards covering revenue, orders, product performance, sales trends, and state-level insights. The dashboards include dynamic KPIs, maps, trend analysis, and category breakdowns, providing a clear view of customer behavior and overall business performance.

title: Employee Pay Intelligence Dashboard — Multi-Page Power BI Report
para: A multi-page Salaries Analysis Dashboard built using Excel, Python (pandas, numpy) for data cleaning, and Power BI for modeling and visualization. The project includes DAX measures, calculated columns, and interactive dashboards analyzing total pay, base pay, overtime, benefits, and job title trends across multiple years.

title: Wish Clothing Sales Analytics & Interactive Dashboard
para: This project transforms raw Excel sales data for clothing products sold on Wish into a clean and structured analytical model. Using Python, I performed data cleaning, feature extraction, and exploratory analysis. Power BI was used to build the data model, create calculated columns and DAX measures, and design a dynamic dashboard showcasing sales, profit, product performance, and geographic insights. The results provide actionable business intelligence to improve pricing, stock management, marketing strategy, and product optimization.

title: ZARA Sales Performance Analysis & Interactive Power BI Dashboard
para: A complete end-to-end data analytics project analyzing ZARA’s sales performance. The dataset was originally provided in multiple Excel files, which were cleaned and prepared using Python (pandas, NumPy). Visual exploratory analysis was performed using Matplotlib and Seaborn to identify early trends and validate data quality. The final cleaned dataset was imported into Power BI, where I built a fully interactive dashboard, implemented DAX measures and calculated columns, and designed a data model to analyze revenue, product performance, pricing, sections, promotions, and store position impact.

title: Mobile Phones Sales Analytics – Interactive Power BI Dashboard
para: A comprehensive data analytics project that explores mobile phone sales performance using real marketplace data. The dataset was cleaned and prepared using Python (Pandas & NumPy), followed by advanced data modeling and DAX calculations in Power BI to build three fully-interactive dashboards.The dashboards provide insights into product prices, discounts, offers, sales performance by brand, customer ratings, and business metrics such as Prime products, Amazon’s Choice, and Best-Seller distribution.This project highlights the end-to-end analytics process from raw data → data cleaning → transformation → modeling → visualization → business insights.

title: Bikes Sales Data Analysis & Interactive Power BI Dashboards
para: This project focuses on analyzing Bikes Sales data using Excel, Python, and Power BI. I performed data cleaning and preprocessing with Pandas and NumPy, and created initial visual explorations using Matplotlib and Seaborn. After preparing the dataset, I built a complete data model in Power BI, created the required DAX measures, and designed three interactive dashboards covering territories performance, product insights, and an overall business overview.

title: Construction Project Financial & Operations Dashboards – FAM Interior (Sample Work)
para: These dashboards are sample visuals from my work at FAM Interior, created to support project finance, operations, and management reporting.They focus on tracking revenue, costs, budgets, and cash flow across multiple construction projects.The dashboards provide visibility into owner billing, subcontractor payments, and approved pay applications.Key KPIs highlight financial performance, variances, and supplier-to-owner ratios.Interactive filters allow analysis by project, company, date, and operational stage.Detailed tables enable drill-down from portfolio level to individual project and invoice level.Monthly trends help monitor payment progress and operational cost movements.This is a simplified sample shared as proof of experience, not the full scope of delivered work.

title: Auto Sales & Weather Impact Dashboard
para: A Auto Sales & Weather Impact Data. The data was cleaned using Python (Pandas, NumPy) and visualized with Matplotlib & Seaborn. Power BI was used for data modeling, DAX measures, and building interactive dashboards that reveal sales trends, regional performance, and key influencers behind recalls and product issues.The project provides clear insights that support decision-making and highlight performance patterns across cities, models, and weather conditions.
subPara: This project is a comprehensive data analytics solution built around four interactive Power BI dashboards that analyze sales performance, weather conditions, and vehicle system recalls. The main objective of the project is to understand how sales trends, regional behavior, and environmental factors such as temperature, wind speed, humidity, and visibility influence sales performance and recall patterns.The data sources for this project were provided as multiple Excel files. These files were consolidated, cleaned, and transformed using Python, primarily leveraging the Pandas and NumPy libraries. During this stage, missing values, inconsistent formats, and duplicated records were handled to ensure data quality and reliability.Before loading the data into Power BI, exploratory data analysis (EDA) was performed using Matplotlib and Seaborn. This step helped in understanding relationships between variables, identifying trends, seasonality, and anomalies, and validating key assumptions related to sales and weather indicators.The cleaned dataset was then imported into Power BI, where a structured data model was designed using proper relationships between fact and dimension tables. Advanced DAX measures and calculated columns were created to compute key performance indicators such as total profit, quantity sold, average profit per sale, monthly and quarterly trends, and system-level recall metrics.The final outcome consists of four well-designed dashboards:A Sales Overview Dashboard that highlights overall sales, profit trends, and performance by model and city.A Weather Indicators Dashboard that monitors temperature, wind speed, humidity, visibility, and weather conditions over time.A Key Influencers Dashboard that identifies the most influential factors behind recalls and system failures.A Geographical & Recall Analysis Dashboard that visualizes regional performance and affected vehicle systems across different locations.Overall, this project demonstrates an end-to-end data analytics workflow, starting from raw Excel data, moving through Python-based data cleaning and analysis, and ending with professional, insight-driven Power BI dashboards that support data-driven decision-making.
